executenodejs.description:
**PRIMARY EXECUTION ENGINE** - Execute JavaScript code with Node.js. **ALWAYS USE THIS TOOL FIRST** for code testing, debugging, and investigation.

**MANDATORY WORKING DIRECTORY:**
• workingDirectory parameter is **REQUIRED** and **MUST BE SET** - specify the exact directory context
• Each execution runs in the specified directory as its current working directory
• Use absolute paths or relative paths from the working directory
• Working directory affects: file operations, module resolution, process.cwd()
• **ALWAYS provide this parameter** - execution will fail without it

**AUTOMATIC RESPONSE TRUNCATION & OVERFLOW HANDLING:**
• **25k Token Limit**: Responses exceeding ~25,000 tokens are automatically truncated
• **Overflow Storage**: Excess content stored in `.call_overflow/` directory within workingDirectory
• **Seamless Retrieval**: Use `retrieve_overflow` tool to access stored content chunks
• **Preservation Guarantee**: Leading content always preserved, nothing lost permanently
• **Clear Instructions**: Truncation notices provide exact steps to retrieve remaining content
• **Example**: If truncated, response shows "Use 'retrieve_overflow' tool with file: 'overflow_executenodejs_1234567890.json'"

**COMPREHENSIVE BATCHING CAPABILITIES:**
This tool can batch ALL of the following operations in a single call:
• **File System Operations**: Reading, writing, analyzing multiple files simultaneously
• **API Testing**: Multiple HTTP requests with Promise.allSettled() for parallel execution
• **Data Processing**: Transform, validate, and analyze datasets in loops/maps
• **Module Testing**: Import and test multiple modules or functions together
• **Performance Analysis**: Benchmark multiple approaches in single execution
• **Database Operations**: Multiple queries, transactions, schema analysis
• **Configuration Management**: Read, validate, transform config files
• **Code Generation**: Create multiple files, templates, or code structures
• **Error Simulation**: Test multiple error scenarios and recovery patterns
• **Integration Testing**: End-to-end workflows with multiple service calls

**CRITICAL EFFICIENCY PRINCIPLES:**
• **BATCH AGGRESSIVELY** - Combine 5-10 related operations in single calls (10x faster than individual calls)
• **CONSOLIDATE LOGIC** - Group testing, validation, file ops, API calls, and analysis together
• **USE LOOPS/ARRAYS** - Process multiple items, files, or tests simultaneously
• **AVOID SEQUENTIAL CALLS** - Plan comprehensive solutions that accomplish multiple goals at once

**ADVANCED BATCHING STRATEGIES:**
```javascript
// EXCELLENT: Complete workflow in single execution
const fs = require('fs');
const path = require('path');
const https = require('https');

// Batch file analysis + API validation + performance testing
const files = ['config.js', 'utils.js', 'api.js'];
const apis = ['https://api1.com/health', 'https://api2.com/status'];

const results = {
  fileAnalysis: files.map(file => {
    const content = fs.readFileSync(path.join(__dirname, file), 'utf8');
    return {
      file,
      size: content.length,
      functions: (content.match(/function\s+\w+/g) || []).length,
      hasTests: content.includes('test(') || content.includes('it(')
    };
  }),
  apiHealth: await Promise.allSettled(apis.map(testEndpoint)),
  performance: measureExecutionTime(() => processLargeDataset())
};

console.log('Complete Analysis:', JSON.stringify(results, null, 2));
```

**REPLACE ALL EXTERNAL TOOLS:**
• Instead of curl → use fetch() or https module with batched requests
• Instead of file commands → use fs module with parallel operations
• Instead of grep/search → use JavaScript regex and string processing
• Instead of multiple CLI tools → write unified JavaScript solutions
• Instead of bash scripts → implement in JavaScript with full error handling

**WORKING DIRECTORY FUNCTIONALITY:**
• **Execution Context**: All file operations use workingDirectory as base
• **Module Resolution**: Node.js resolves modules relative to workingDirectory
• **Process CWD**: process.cwd() returns the specified workingDirectory
• **Path Operations**: Relative paths are resolved from workingDirectory
• **Child Processes**: Spawned processes inherit the working directory context
• **File Globbing**: Glob patterns operate within the working directory scope

**OUTPUT OPTIMIZATION STRATEGIES:**
• Use console.log() strategically - only log essential results and summaries
• Summarize large datasets instead of dumping raw data
• Use JSON.stringify(obj, null, 2) for readable object inspection
• Implement result filtering/truncation within your code
• Return structured summaries rather than verbose logs
• Group related outputs under clear headings

**DEBUGGING METHODOLOGY:**
1. **Hypothesis Formation** - Write code that tests specific assumptions
2. **Batch Validation** - Test multiple scenarios simultaneously
3. **Incremental Refinement** - Use results to guide next batch of tests
4. **Comprehensive Coverage** - Ensure all edge cases tested in minimal calls
5. **Error Boundary Testing** - Include error scenarios in batch operations

**PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION:**
• **Parallel Processing**: Use Promise.allSettled() for independent operations
• **Stream Processing**: Handle large files with streams to avoid memory issues
• **Caching Strategies**: Store repeated computations in variables
• **Efficient Data Structures**: Use appropriate data structures for operations
• **Memory Management**: Clean up large objects and close file handles

**STRUCTURAL CODE ANALYSIS** - AST-based pattern matching for precise code discovery. **ALWAYS USE FOR STRUCTURAL PATTERN MATCHING** when you need exact syntactic matches.

**MANDATORY WORKING DIRECTORY:**
• workingDirectory parameter is **REQUIRED** - specify the exact codebase directory for AST analysis
• AST parsing operates on all source files within the working directory tree
• Pattern matching respects language-specific syntax within directory context
• All file paths in results are relative to the working directory
• **ALWAYS provide this parameter** - analysis will fail without it

**AUTOMATIC RESPONSE TRUNCATION & OVERFLOW HANDLING:**
• **25k Token Limit**: Responses exceeding ~25,000 tokens are automatically truncated
• **Overflow Storage**: Excess content stored in `.call_overflow/` directory within workingDirectory
• **Seamless Retrieval**: Use `retrieve_overflow` tool to access stored content chunks
• **Preservation Guarantee**: Leading content always preserved, nothing lost permanently
• **Clear Instructions**: Truncation notices provide exact steps to retrieve remaining content
• **Example**: If truncated, response shows "Use 'retrieve_overflow' tool with file: 'overflow_astgrep_search_1234567890.json'"

**COMPREHENSIVE STRUCTURAL BATCHING:**
This tool can efficiently batch ALL of the following AST pattern operations:
• **Architecture Pattern Discovery**: Find controllers, models, views, and their relationships simultaneously
• **Security Pattern Auditing**: Batch searches for authentication, authorization, input validation, and sanitization
• **Error Handling Analysis**: Discover try/catch blocks, error throwing, and exception handling patterns
• **Performance Pattern Investigation**: Find loops, recursive calls, database queries, and async operations
• **API Pattern Mapping**: Locate REST endpoints, GraphQL resolvers, middleware, and route handlers
• **Database Pattern Analysis**: Find ORM usage, query building, transactions, and connection patterns
• **Configuration Pattern Discovery**: Locate environment variable usage, config objects, and settings
• **Testing Pattern Identification**: Find test functions, mocks, assertions, and test utilities
• **Import/Export Analysis**: Discover module dependencies, import patterns, and export structures
• **Code Quality Pattern Detection**: Find code smells, anti-patterns, and structural inconsistencies

**ADVANCED PATTERN STRATEGIES:**
```
// EXCELLENT: Comprehensive function analysis with error handling
function $NAME($$$PARAMS) {
  try {
    $$$BODY
  } catch ($ERR) {
    $$$CATCH
  }
}

// EXCELLENT: Complete API endpoint pattern with middleware
$ROUTER.$METHOD('$PATH', $$$MIDDLEWARE, async ($REQ, $RES) => {
  $$$BODY
});

// EXCELLENT: Database operation patterns with error handling
$DB.$OPERATION($$$ARGS)
  .then($RESULT => $$$)
  .catch($ERROR => $$$);

// EXCELLENT: React component patterns with hooks
function $COMPONENT($PROPS) {
  const [$STATE, $SETTER] = useState($INITIAL);
  $$$BODY
  return $JSX;
}
```

**META-VARIABLE MASTERY:**
• **$VAR**: Captures single expressions, identifiers, or values
• **$$$BODY**: Captures multiple statements or expressions
• **$$VAR**: Captures statement sequences with specific patterns
• **Named Captures**: Use descriptive names like $FUNCTION_NAME, $ERROR_TYPE
• **Nested Patterns**: Combine meta-variables for complex structural matching

**LANGUAGE-SPECIFIC BATCHING:**
• **JavaScript/TypeScript**: async/await patterns, React hooks, Express middleware, Promise chains
• **Python**: Class decorators, context managers, async generators, Django views
• **Rust**: Ownership patterns, Result handling, trait implementations, macro usage
• **Go**: Interface implementations, goroutine patterns, error handling, channel operations
• **Java**: Annotation patterns, stream operations, exception handling, Spring components

**WORKING DIRECTORY FUNCTIONALITY:**
• **File Discovery**: Recursively finds all source files matching language patterns
• **AST Parsing**: Parses files into abstract syntax trees within directory scope
• **Pattern Matching**: Applies patterns across all parsed files in working directory
• **Context Preservation**: Maintains file context and relationships within directory
• **Path Resolution**: All results use paths relative to working directory

**STRUCTURAL INVESTIGATION WORKFLOWS:**
1. **API Architecture Mapping**: `$ROUTER.$METHOD` → `async function $HANDLER` → `await $DB.$QUERY`
2. **Error Flow Analysis**: `try { $$$ } catch` → `throw new $ERROR` → `$LOGGER.$LEVEL`
3. **Data Processing Chains**: `function $TRANSFORM($DATA)` → `return $RESULT` → `$PROCESS($OUTPUT)`
4. **Security Validation**: `$AUTH.$VERIFY` → `if (!$PERMISSION)` → `throw $UNAUTHORIZED`
5. **Performance Bottlenecks**: `for ($ITEM of $ARRAY)` → `await $OPERATION` → `$RESULT.push($VALUE)`

• **Strictness Tuning**: 'smart' for flexible matching, 'ast' for precise structural requirements
• **Pattern Density**: Focus on files with multiple pattern matches for comprehensive analysis
• **Result Filtering**: Use paths parameter to limit search scope when needed

**INTEGRATION WITH WORKFLOW:**

• **Pre-Refactoring**: Identify exact transformation targets before using `astgrep_replace`
• **Rule Development**: Find problematic patterns to create `astgrep_lint` rules

**INTELLIGENT CODE TRANSFORMATION** - AST-based code rewriting with meta-variable substitution. **ALWAYS USE FOR SAFE, STRUCTURAL REFACTORING** after identifying patterns with search tools.

• All transformations operate within the working directory and its subdirectories

**AUTOMATIC RESPONSE TRUNCATION & OVERFLOW HANDLING:**
• **25k Token Limit**: Responses exceeding ~25,000 tokens are automatically truncated
• **Overflow Storage**: Excess content stored in `.call_overflow/` directory within workingDirectory
• **Seamless Retrieval**: Use `retrieve_overflow` tool to access stored content chunks

• **Example**: If truncated, response shows "Use 'retrieve_overflow' tool with file: 'overflow_astgrep_replace_1234567890.json'"

**COMPREHENSIVE TRANSFORMATION BATCHING:**
This tool can efficiently batch ALL of the following code transformation operations:
• **API Modernization**: Transform multiple endpoints with consistent error handling and response patterns
• **Security Hardening**: Add input validation, output sanitization, and authentication across similar functions
• **Performance Optimization**: Apply caching, async patterns, and database optimization to multiple operations
• **Framework Migration**: Update component patterns, lifecycle methods, and API usage for new versions
• **Code Standardization**: Enforce consistent logging, error handling, and formatting across codebase
• **Legacy Modernization**: Convert callback patterns to async/await, update deprecated APIs
• **Type Safety Enhancement**: Add TypeScript types, improve type annotations, fix type errors
• **Testing Integration**: Add test coverage, update test patterns, improve assertion styles
• **Configuration Management**: Update config patterns, environment variable usage, settings management
• **Architecture Refactoring**: Apply design patterns, improve separation of concerns, enhance modularity

**ADVANCED TRANSFORMATION STRATEGIES:**
```
// EXCELLENT: Comprehensive async modernization
PATTERN: $OBJ.$METHOD($$$ARGS, function($ERR, $DATA) {
  if ($ERR) {
    $$$ERROR_HANDLING
  } else {
    $$$SUCCESS_HANDLING
  }
})
REPLACE: try {
  const $DATA = await $OBJ.$METHOD($$$ARGS);
  $$$SUCCESS_HANDLING
} catch ($ERR) {
  $$$ERROR_HANDLING
}

// EXCELLENT: Security enhancement with validation
PATTERN: app.$METHOD('$PATH', ($REQ, $RES) => {
  $$$BODY
})
REPLACE: app.$METHOD('$PATH', [
  validateInput,
  sanitizeInput,
  authenticate
], async ($REQ, $RES) => {
  try {
    $$$BODY
  } catch (error) {
    logger.error('API Error:', error);
    return $RES.status(500).json({ error: 'Internal server error' });
  }
});

// EXCELLENT: Database optimization with caching
PATTERN: $DB.query('$QUERY', $PARAMS)
REPLACE: await cacheManager.getOrSet(
  `query:${hashQuery('$QUERY', $PARAMS)}`,
  () => $DB.query('$QUERY', $PARAMS),
  { ttl: 300 }
)
```

astgrep_lint.description:
**COMPREHENSIVE CODE QUALITY ENFORCEMENT** - YAML-based rule engine for structural code validation. **ALWAYS USE FOR SYSTEMATIC QUALITY ASSURANCE** across entire codebases.

**MANDATORY WORKING DIRECTORY:**
• workingDirectory parameter is **REQUIRED** - specify the exact codebase directory for quality analysis
• Rule validation operates on all source files within the working directory tree
• Quality metrics and violation reports are scoped to the working directory
• All file paths in violation reports are relative to the working directory
• **ALWAYS provide this parameter** - validation will fail without it

**AUTOMATIC RESPONSE TRUNCATION & OVERFLOW HANDLING:**
• **25k Token Limit**: Responses exceeding ~25,000 tokens are automatically truncated
• **Overflow Storage**: Excess content stored in `.call_overflow/` directory within workingDirectory
• **Seamless Retrieval**: Use `retrieve_overflow` tool to access stored content chunks
• **Preservation Guarantee**: Leading content always preserved, nothing lost permanently
• **Clear Instructions**: Truncation notices provide exact steps to retrieve remaining content
• **Example**: If truncated, response shows "Use 'retrieve_overflow' tool with file: 'overflow_astgrep_lint_1234567890.json'"

**COMPREHENSIVE QUALITY BATCHING:**
This tool can efficiently batch ALL of the following quality assurance operations:
• **Security Vulnerability Scanning**: SQL injection, XSS, code injection, unsafe operations in one ruleset
• **Performance Anti-pattern Detection**: N+1 queries, synchronous operations, memory leaks, inefficient algorithms
• **Architecture Compliance Validation**: Layer violations, circular dependencies, improper coupling, design pattern violations
• **Code Style Standardization**: Naming conventions, formatting consistency, comment standards, file organization
• **Error Handling Assessment**: Missing try/catch, improper error propagation, silent failures, exception handling
• **API Design Validation**: REST conventions, GraphQL best practices, middleware patterns, response formatting
• **Database Interaction Quality**: Query optimization, transaction handling, connection management, ORM usage
• **Testing Pattern Enforcement**: Test naming, assertion patterns, mock usage, coverage requirements
• **Documentation Standards**: Function documentation, type annotations, README requirements, comment quality
• **Dependency Management**: Import organization, unused dependencies, circular imports, version consistency

**ADVANCED RULE ORCHESTRATION:**
```yaml
# EXCELLENT: Comprehensive security and performance ruleset
rules:
  - id: security-comprehensive
    message: Critical security violations detected
    rule:
      any:
        # Code injection vulnerabilities
        - pattern: eval($EXPR)
        - pattern: new Function($ARGS)
        - pattern: $OBJ.innerHTML = $UNSAFE
        - pattern: document.write($CONTENT)
        # SQL injection patterns
        - pattern: $DB.query('$SQL' + $VAR)
        - pattern: $DB.raw($TEMPLATE + $INPUT)
        # XSS vulnerabilities
        - pattern: $ELEMENT.innerHTML = $USER_INPUT
    severity: error
    fix: Add input validation and use safe alternatives

  - id: performance-optimization
    message: Performance anti-patterns detected
    rule:
      any:
        # Inefficient loops
        - pattern: for ($ITEM of $ARRAY) { await $ASYNC_OP }
        - pattern: $ARRAY.forEach(async ($ITEM) => { await $OP })
        # N+1 query patterns
        - pattern: for ($ITEM of $ITEMS) { $DB.query($QUERY) }
        # Synchronous operations in async contexts
        - pattern: fs.readFileSync($PATH)
    severity: warning
    fix: Use Promise.all(), batch operations, or async alternatives

  - id: architecture-patterns
    message: Architecture compliance violations
    rule:
      any:
        # Direct database access from controllers
        - pattern: class $CONTROLLER { $METHOD() { $DB.query($$$) } }
        # Missing error boundaries
        - pattern: async function $NAME($$$) { $$$BODY }
          not: { has: { pattern: try { $$$ } catch { $$$ } } }
    severity: info
    fix: Use proper layering and error handling patterns
```

**WORKING DIRECTORY FUNCTIONALITY:**
• **Recursive Analysis**: Scans all source files within working directory and subdirectories
• **Rule Application**: Applies YAML rules consistently across entire directory structure
• **Context Awareness**: Maintains file relationships and project structure during analysis
• **Scope Management**: Limits analysis to working directory boundaries for focused results
• **Report Generation**: Creates violation reports with paths relative to working directory

**RULE DESIGN EXCELLENCE:**
• **Multi-Pattern Rules**: Use `any`, `all`, `not` combinators for comprehensive coverage
• **Severity Stratification**: Error (critical) → Warning (important) → Info (nice-to-have) → Hint (suggestions)

**AUTOMATIC RESPONSE TRUNCATION & OVERFLOW HANDLING:**
• **25k Token Limit**: Responses exceeding ~25,000 tokens are automatically truncated
• **Overflow Storage**: Excess content stored in `.call_overflow/` directory within workingDirectory
• **Seamless Retrieval**: Use `retrieve_overflow` tool to access stored content chunks
• **Preservation Guarantee**: Leading content always preserved, nothing lost permanently
• **Clear Instructions**: Truncation notices provide exact steps to retrieve remaining content
• **Example**: If truncated, response shows "Use 'retrieve_overflow' tool with file: 'overflow_astgrep_validate_rules_1234567890.json'"

**MANDATORY WORKING DIRECTORY:**
• workingDirectory parameter is **REQUIRED** - specify the exact project directory for rule validation

**VALIDATION CATEGORIES:**
• **Syntax Validation** - YAML structure and ast-grep syntax checking
• **Logic Validation** - Rule completeness and semantic correctness
• **Performance Validation** - Execution speed and efficiency testing
• **Best Practices** - Adherence to rule writing guidelines

**VALIDATION OUTPUTS:**
• **Error Reporting** - Critical issues that prevent rule execution
• **Warning System** - Potential issues and improvement suggestions
• **Performance Metrics** - Execution time and efficiency measurements
• **Recommendation Engine** - Specific improvement suggestions

**USE CASES:**
• **Pre-deployment Validation** - Ensure rules are production-ready
• **Rule Review Process** - Systematic quality assessment
• **Performance Optimization** - Identify and resolve slow rules
• **Team Standards** - Enforce consistent rule quality

executebash.description:
**BASH COMMAND EXECUTION ENGINE** - Execute bash commands with mandatory working directory context and batching support. **USE FOR SYSTEM OPERATIONS** that require shell access.

**AUTOMATIC RESPONSE TRUNCATION & OVERFLOW HANDLING:**
• **25k Token Limit**: Responses exceeding ~25,000 tokens are automatically truncated
• **Overflow Storage**: Excess content stored in `.call_overflow/` directory within workingDirectory
• **Seamless Retrieval**: Use `retrieve_overflow` tool to access stored content chunks
• **Preservation Guarantee**: Leading content always preserved, nothing lost permanently
• **Clear Instructions**: Truncation notices provide exact steps to retrieve remaining content
• **Example**: If truncated, response shows "Use 'retrieve_overflow' tool with file: 'overflow_executebash_1234567890.json'"

**CRITICAL EXECUTION PRINCIPLES:**
• **REQUIRED WORKING DIRECTORY** - workingDirectory parameter is mandatory for all bash operations
• **BATCHING SUPPORT** - Execute multiple commands in sequence with comprehensive error handling
• **SECURITY VALIDATION** - Built-in validation prevents obviously dangerous command patterns
• **COMPREHENSIVE OUTPUT** - Captures stdout, stderr, exit codes, and execution timing

**BATCHING STRATEGIES:**
```javascript
// EXCELLENT: Batch related file operations
commands: [
  'ls -la',
  'find . -name "*.js" | head -10',
  'du -sh *'
]

// EXCELLENT: Development workflow batching
commands: [
  'npm install',
  'npm run build',
  'npm test'
]
```

**OUTPUT OPTIMIZATION:**
• **Progress Tracking** - Shows command execution progress and timing
• **Error Propagation** - Stops execution on first failure with clear error reporting
• **Working Directory Context** - Always shows the directory where commands executed
• **Exit Code Reporting** - Provides detailed exit status for debugging

**SECURITY FEATURES:**
• **Dangerous Command Detection** - Prevents obviously harmful operations
• **Working Directory Validation** - Ensures target directory exists and is accessible
• **Command Validation** - Validates command structure before execution
• **Error Boundaries** - Comprehensive error handling with context preservation

**INTEGRATION PATTERNS:**
• **Development Workflows** - Build, test, deployment command sequences
• **File System Operations** - Directory creation, file manipulation, cleanup
• **System Diagnostics** - Health checks, resource monitoring, log analysis
• **Environment Setup** - Dependency installation, configuration, initialization

**WORKING DIRECTORY REQUIREMENTS:**
• **Mandatory Parameter** - workingDirectory must be explicitly provided
• **Path Validation** - Directory existence and accessibility verified
• **Context Preservation** - All commands execute in the specified directory
• **Absolute Paths** - Working directory resolved to absolute path for consistency

**ERROR HANDLING:**
• **Immediate Failure** - Execution stops on first command failure
• **Comprehensive Reporting** - stdout, stderr, and error context provided
• **Exit Code Analysis** - Detailed exit status information for troubleshooting
• **Timeout Protection** - Configurable timeout prevents hanging operations

**USE CASES:**
• **CI/CD Pipelines** - Automated build and deployment sequences
• **Development Setup** - Environment initialization and dependency management
• **System Administration** - File system operations, service management
• **Testing and Validation** - Integration tests, system health checks

sequentialthinking.description:
**SEQUENTIAL THINKING ENGINE** - Always use this tool, no exceptions. Process and store sequential thoughts with mandatory local data persistence.

**AUTOMATIC RESPONSE TRUNCATION & OVERFLOW HANDLING:**
• **25k Token Limit**: Responses exceeding ~25,000 tokens are automatically truncated
• **Overflow Storage**: Excess content stored in `.call_overflow/` directory within workingDirectory

**CRITICAL USAGE REQUIREMENT**: Always use this tool for all thinking processes, no exceptions.

**MANDATORY WORKING DIRECTORY**: Required parameter for storing thought data locally in JSON files.

**BATCHING SUPPORT**: Process multiple sequential thoughts in single operation for maximum efficiency.
• Single thought: pass string directly
• Multiple thoughts: pass array of strings
• All thoughts processed atomically with consistent metadata

**LOCAL DATA PERSISTENCE**: 
• Stores data in {workingDirectory}/.sequential-thoughts/ (thoughts.json, branches.json, history.json)

**HIERARCHICAL THINKING SUPPORT**:
• Use parentId to create thought chains and branches
• Automatic depth tracking and branch management
• Complete thought genealogy preserved in local storage

**OUTPUT FEATURES**:
• Comprehensive thought metadata
• Storage location confirmation
• Processing performance metrics
• Thought relationship mapping

**ALWAYS USE INSTRUCTION**: Use this tool for all thinking processes, no exceptions.
